page.title: 13Barby Village Hall
page.content: The Village Hall is the centre of the community life in Barby. When the new school was built the old school was extended and became the Village hall. There are several small rooms a kitchen and a big hall. The hall is used on many days for badminton although the roof isn't really high enough. Other rooms are used as a doctor's surgery when the doctor comes. The Youth Club use the hall once a week. The old age pensioners meet regularly in one of the rooms. It is possible for anyone to hire the hall but it can cost as much as Â£40 for a Saturday night dance. The hall also has a stage that can be used for plays and concerts. Barby's Village Hall is much better than Kilsby's. Kilsby is having their Village Hall extended this year.
